statements.name: PROC SGPANEL
statements.description: Creates a panel of plots from input data.

statements.name: PANELBY
statements.description: Specifies one or more classification variables for the panel, the layout type, and other options for the panel.

statements.name: STYLEATTRS
statements.description: Specifies group attributes for a graph. The statement enables you to change group colors, markers, and so on, within the procedure, without having to change the ODS style template.

statements.name: BAND
statements.description: Creates a band that highlights part of a plot.
statements.help:
BAND X=variable |  Y=variable |   
 UPPER=numeric-value  |  numeric-variable
 LOWER=numeric-valuenumeric-variable
</option(s)>;

statements.name: BLOCK
statements.description: Creates one or more rectangular blocks containing text values. The block widths are determined by a specified block variable.

statements.name: BUBBLE
statements.description: Creates a bubble plot in which two variables determine the location of the bubble centers and a third variable controls the size of the bubble.

statements.name: DENSITY
statements.description: Creates a density curve that shows the distribution of values in your data.

statements.name: DOT
statements.description: Creates a dot plot that summarizes the values of a category variable.

statements.name: DROPLINE
statements.description: Creates one or more drop lines from data points to one or both axes. The line or lines can be horizontal, vertical, or both.

statements.name: ELLIPSE
statements.description: Adds a confidence or prediction ellipse to a primary plot.

statements.name: ELLIPSEPARM
statements.description: Adds an ellipse to the primary plot, specified by axis, slope, and origin parameters. The axis parameters are required.

statements.name: FRINGE
statements.description: Creates a fringe plot on the X axis of an X-Y plot.

statements.name: GRADLEGEND
statements.description: Generates a gradient legend that maps the data range of a response variable to a range of colors. You can use up to four GRADLEGEND statements in a procedure. The GRADLEGEND statement is used in conjunction with the COLORRESPONSE= option. (The COLORRESPONSE= option is specified in the plot statement and indicates the response variable that is used to map the colors.)

statements.name: HBAR
statements.description: Creates a bar chart that summarizes the values of a category variable.

statements.name: HBARBASIC
statements.description: Creates a horizontal bar chart that is compatible with other categorization charts as well as basic plots, such as scatter and series plots, and box plots.

statements.name: HBARPARM
statements.description: Creates a horizontal bar chart based on a pre-summarized response value for each unique value of the category variable. You can also assign variables to the upper and lower limits.

statements.name: HBOX
statements.description: Creates a horizontal box plot that shows the distribution of your data.

statements.name: HEATMAP
statements.description: Creates a plot of color-coded rectangles for the response variable of a pair of X and Y variables after it bins the data in two dimensions.

statements.name: HEATMAPPARM
statements.description: Creates a plot that represents the values of three variables. Generating an X, Y grid of rectangles from the values of two independent variables, it colors the rectangles to represent the values of a third variable, which can be a response variable or a group variable.

statements.name: HIGHLOW
statements.description: Creates a display of floating vertical or horizontal lines or bars that represent high and low values. The statement also gives you the option to display open and close values as tick marks and to specify a variety of plot attributes.

statements.name: HISTOGRAM
statements.description: Creates a histogram that displays the frequency distribution of a numeric value.

statements.name: HLINE
statements.description: Creates a horizontal line chart (the line is vertical). You can use the HLINE statement with the HBAR statement to create a horizontal bar-line chart.

statements.name: INSET
statements.description: Adds a text box to each panel cell of the graph.

statements.name: KEYLEGEND
statements.description: Adds a legend to the plot.

statements.name: LEGENDITEM
statements.description: Creates a legend item that can be included in the legend. The LEGENDITEM statement must be used with one or more plot statements. The procedure can contain multiple LEGENDITEM statements.

statements.name: LINEPARM
statements.description: Creates a straight line specified by a point and a slope. You can generate a single line by specifying a constant for each required argument. You can generate multiple lines by specifying a numeric variable for any or all required arguments.

statements.name: LOESS
statements.description: Creates a fitted loess curve.

statements.name: NEEDLE
statements.description: Creates a plot with needles connecting each point to the baseline.

statements.name: PBSPLINE
statements.description: Creates a fitted penalized B-spline curve.

statements.name: POLYGON
statements.description: Draws a polygon from data stored in a data set.

statements.name: REFLINE
statements.description: Creates a horizontal or vertical reference line.

statements.name: REG
statements.description: Creates a fitted regression line or curve.

statements.name: SCATTER
statements.description: Creates a scatter plot.

statements.name: SERIES
statements.description: Creates a series plot.

statements.name: SPLINE
statements.description: Creates a series plot with a quadratic Bézier spline interpolation that produces smooth curves.

statements.name: STEP
statements.description: Creates a step plot.

statements.name: SYMBOLCHAR
statements.description: Defines a marker symbol using a Unicode character that can be referenced in other statements. The procedure can contain more than one SYMBOLCHAR statement.

statements.name: SYMBOLIMAGE
statements.description: Defines a marker symbol using an image. The marker symbol can then be referenced in other statements.

statements.name: TEXT
statements.description: Displays the associated text values at (X, Y) locations in the graph. The text can be numbers or characters.

statements.name: VBAR
statements.description: Creates a vertical bar chart that summarizes the values of a category variable.

statements.name: VBARBASIC
statements.description: Creates a vertical bar chart that is compatible with other categorization charts as well as basic plots, such as scatter and series plots, and box plots.

statements.name: VBARPARM
statements.description: Creates a vertical bar chart based on a pre-summarized response value for each unique value of the category variable. You can also assign variables to the upper and lower limits.

statements.name: VBOX
statements.description: Creates a vertical box plot that shows the distribution of your data.

statements.name: VECTOR
statements.description: Creates a vector plot that draws arrows from a point of origin to each data point.

statements.name: VLINE
statements.description: Creates a vertical line chart (the line is horizontal). You can use the VLINE statement with the VBAR statement to create a bar-line chart.

statements.name: COLAXIS
statements.description: Specifies the axis options for each X axis in the panel.

statements.name: COLAXISTABLE
statements.description: Creates a basic plot that displays data values at specific locations along the horizontal axis.

statements.name: ROWAXIS
statements.description: Specifies the axis options for each Y axis in the panel.

statements.name: ROWAXISTABLE
statements.description: Creates a basic plot that displays data values at specific locations along the vertical axis.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

statements.name: FORMAT
statements.description: Associates formats with variables.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.description: Assigns descriptive labels to variables.
statements.help:
Form 1: Creates a descriptive label for one or more variables.
LABEL variable-1=’text-string’ < ...variable-n=’text-string>; 
Form 2: Removes the label from one or more variables.
LABEL variable-1 = ' ' < ...variable-n=’ ‘>; | variable-1 = < ...variable-n= >

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.
